task

Class ToDoListManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • task.ToDoListManager

  • public class ToDoListManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the list manager that enables the user to add, remove, toggle complete or not, view, save, load, and sort the tasks in numerous ways. User can also exit and interact with the program. This class works directly with the other classes in order to ensure the program menu and calls work correctly.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nathan M. Abbey

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ToDoListManager()
      This default constructor that initializes the array list and scanner.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTask()
      This method adds a task to the array list.
      void loadTasks()
      This method loads a task list from an already existing text file on a computer.
      void removeTask()
      This method removes a task from the ArrayList.
      void runToDoList()
      This method displays the menu for the program and re-directs the user to the chosen method.
      void saveTasks()
      This method saves the tasks inputed onto the computer in a text file.
      void sortByIsComplete()
      This method sorts the tasks; not complete on top, is complete on bottom.
      void sortByPriority()
      This method sorts the tasks from high to medium to low.
      void sortByTitle()
      This method sorts the tasks alphabetically by title.
      void toggleTaskComplete()
      This method toggles the icComplete boolean.
      void viewTasks()
      This method prints out a list of the tasks in the ArrayList.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        This default constructor that initializes the array list and scanner.

    • Method Detail

      • runToDoList

        public void runToDoList()
        This method displays the menu for the program and re-directs the user to the chosen method. It also checks the input is valid.
        Since:
        1.0

      • addTask

        public void addTask()
        This method adds a task to the array list. It accepts the title and priority of the task; ensuring both are within certain parameters.
        Since:
        1.0

      • toggleTaskComplete

        public void toggleTaskComplete()
        This method toggles the icComplete boolean. True means is complete, false means is not complete. It ensures the input is valid and not out of bounds.
        Since:
        1.0

      • removeTask

        public void removeTask()
        This method removes a task from the ArrayList. It prompts for the index number. It validates the input to ensure it is an integer within the range of the ArrayList.
        Since:
        1.0

      • viewTasks

        public void viewTasks()
        This method prints out a list of the tasks in the ArrayList. If none are present it indicates there is nothing to show.
        Since:
        1.0

      • saveTasks

        public void saveTasks()
        This method saves the tasks inputed onto the computer in a text file.
        Since:
        1.0

      • loadTasks

        public void loadTasks()
        This method loads a task list from an already existing text file on a computer.
        Since:
        1.0

      • sortByTitle

        public void sortByTitle()
        This method sorts the tasks alphabetically by title.
        Since:
        1.0

      • sortByPriority

        public void sortByPriority()
        This method sorts the tasks from high to medium to low.
        Since:
        1.0

      • sortByIsComplete

        public void sortByIsComplete()
        This method sorts the tasks; not complete on top, is complete on bottom.
        Since:
        1.0
